title: Trump Threatens Steep Tariffs on Goods From E.U. and Mexico
summary: Leaders from both economies had been trying to negotiate more favorable terms, only to have those efforts blown up by form letters.

title: Rubio Visits Asia in Shadow of Trump’s Tariffs
summary: Marco Rubio made his first visit to Asia as secretary of state. Edward Wong, a diplomatic correspondent for The New York Times, reports from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, to explain how President Trump’s tariffs have upset U.S. trading partners.

title: After Months of Negotiations, Trump Imposes More Tariffs on Mexico
summary: The tariffs are likely to inflame tensions with one of the largest U.S. trading partners.

title: Trump Threatens Fresh Tariffs on E.U., Mexico and Canada: What to Know
summary: Since re-entering office, President Trump has announced a barrage of tariffs to try to rewire the global economy.

title: Texans Offer a Hand and Open Their Hearts as Flood Death Toll Grows
summary: Mourners paid tribute at funerals and memorial services on Saturday as the number of fatalities rose to nearly 130.

title: After Texas Floods, Summer Camps Reassess Safety Measures Amid Parental Concerns
summary: Camp officials across the country said they had heard from worried parents after the Texas floods. As they try to reassure them, some camps are adding more safety procedures.

title: FEMA Approved Removal of Many Camp Mystic Buildings From Flood Zones
summary: Camp Mystic owners successfully appealed to the Federal Emergency Management Agency to redesignate some buildings that had been considered part of a flood-hazard zone.

title: Texas Flood Survivors: Mother of Five Returns to Cabin in Ruins
summary: Jacque White and her five children escaped the rising waters of the Guadalupe River just in time. Now they have to rebuild.

title: ICE Set to Vastly Expand Its Reach With New Funds
summary: After the passage of President Trump’s domestic policy law, the Department of Homeland Security is poised to hire thousands of new immigration agents and double detention space.

title: Trump’s Birthright Citizenship Ban Faces New Peril: Class Actions
summary: In last month’s decision limiting one judicial tool, universal injunctions, the court seemed to invite lower courts to use class actions as an alternative.

title: Trump Pleads With Followers to Back Bondi in Dispute Over Epstein Inquiry
summary: In a long social media post, President Trump praised Attorney General Pam Bondi and told his followers to “not waste Time and Energy” on the Jeffrey Epstein case.

title: UnitedHealth’s Campaign to Quiet Critics
summary: The company has invoked the murder of an executive last year to complain about coverage in news outlets, on streaming services and on social media.

title: Our Investigation of UnitedHealth Started With a Tip
summary: A reporter was familiar with the insurance giant under scrutiny and the law firm known for its attack stance. Then one hired the other.

title: Modi Wants More Indians to Speak Hindi. Some States Are Shouting ‘No.’
summary: States worry that the imposition of Hindi, the main language of northern India, would wipe out their cultural heritage.

title: You Saved and Saved for Retirement. Now You Need a Plan to Cash Out.
summary: Most people enter retirement without any idea how to manage withdrawing their savings without running out of money. Here is what you need to know.

title: New Student Loan Limits Could Leave Some Short. Who Will Help?
summary: The federal cap on the amounts people can borrow means some of them will fall short. That’s especially true for students in professional schools.

title: They Fled War in Ethiopia. Then American Bombs Found Them.
summary: In April, U.S.-made bombs destroyed a detention facility that held Ethiopian migrants in Yemen, crushing bodies and shredding limbs. Amid official silence, the survivors are left wondering why.

title: Texas Court Seals Records in Ken Paxton’s Divorce Case
summary: The order meant details in the case, which involves allegations of adultery, would not be public as the Texas attorney general challenges Senator John Cornyn in the 2026 primary.

title: It’s YouTube vs. Netflix as the Streaming Wars Come Down to 2
summary: The two giant video companies have far different strategies, but the same goal: controlling your TV set.

title: ‘He’s Nuts, Your Trump.’ Canada Unites Against America.
summary: America’s growing discord with Canada exemplifies the extraordinary damage President Trump is wreaking on the United States’ standing in the world.

title: Trump’s Cabinet of Incompetents
summary: Putting talking heads in charge — not the best idea.

title: Two Palestinians Are Killed in a West Bank Clash With Israeli Settlers
summary: Palestinian authorities and family members said Israeli settlers beat and killed a Palestinian-American man. Israel said the violence began when Palestinians threw stones at Israeli civilians.

title: A Grand Canyon Access Point Is Closed as 19,000 Acres Burn Nearby
summary: Access via the North Rim, a lesser-used gateway to the national park, was closed as the White Sage fire continued to burn on Saturday.

title: Bill Dilworth, Caretaker of ‘The New York Earth Room,’ Is Dead at 70
summary: For decades, he tended a SoHo loft filled with dirt, made by the conceptual artist Walter De Maria. People made pilgrimages to see it — and Mr. Dilworth, its magnetic steward.

title: Spend an Hour in the Dark With Bats, Cats and Naked Mole Rats
summary: The Bronx Zoo has reopened its World of Darkness exhibit after a 16-year hiatus.
